prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories: Police have released a description of the 27-year-old woman, saying she was in her early 20s at the time of the incident and was accompanied by two other people, including the baby's father.
The description stated that the woman is approximately 5'8" tall with curly brown hair and hazel eyes, and was last seen wearing a black hoodie and jeans.
She was said to have been carrying a small black backpack and was reportedly wearing white sneakers, but unfortunately, no distinctive features or markings were mentioned.
The authorities were quick to respond to the scene, setting up a perimeter and canvassing the area for any witnesses who may have seen the girl wandering away from her family.

As the police officers began to survey the area, they noticed a young boy, no more than 10 years old, hovering around the perimeter, his eyes fixed on the scene. One of the officers, a seasoned veteran, decided to approach the boy and ask him what he was doing there, wondering if he might have seen or heard something relevant to the investigation.

The boy's eyes darted to the officer and back to the scene, before slowly shaking his head. "I was just... just trying to find my dog," he said, his voice trembling slightly. "I think I might have left him outside when I saw the flashing lights and came to see what was happening." The officer's eyebrow arched in curiosity as he leaned down to examine the boy more closely. "What's your dog's name?" he asked, trying to keep his tone gentle.

"Rufus," the boy replied, his eyes welling up with tears as he gazed out at the mess around him. "He's a big ol' golden retriever, and he loves to run off sometimes. I'm sure he's just scared and hiding."

"But what if he's not? What if something really happened to him?" Rufus's owner, a petite girl with curly brown hair, asked, her voice trembling as she looked down at the small trail of paw prints leading out the open door.

"She's going to start freaking out for real if she doesn't find him soon," one of the kids playing in the park nearby called out to his friend, squinting towards the commotion at the house. The girl, now standing in the doorway, her eyes scanning the yard as if searching for any sign of Rufus, took a step forward, her mind racing with all the terrible things that could have happened to her beloved cat.
"Maybe she should let us help her look," the other kid suggested, climbing down from the jungle gym, his eyes shining with excitement at the prospect of an adventure.

"Shh, don't tell her, but I already snuck a peek and saw her hiding a map in her backpack," whispered Tom, his eyes darting around the playground to make sure no one was listening, "I think it's a treasure map!"

"Whoa, that's so cool! Maybe it's a clue to the missing treasure from the school's anniversary celebration last year," whispered Sarah, her eyes sparkling with excitement, "Do you think she's going to use it to find the treasure tonight?"

"I don't know, but we should definitely tag along and see," replied Alex, her voice barely above a whisper, "Let's follow her from afar and make sure she doesn't get herself lost in the woods, it's dark out here and we don't know what kind of creatures roam around these days."

"As I said, it's not like we have a choice, but I agree, we should be careful. I've heard stories about these woods, about people who have ventured in and never come back. Let's stay close, stick together, and keep a watchful eye out for anything unusual. Oh, and by the way, do you see that strange marking on the tree over there? It looks like a symbol or something," Ember said, her eyes scanning the surrounding area.

"What kind of symbol is it?" I asked, my gaze flicking to the tree and back to Ember's concerned expression. "It looks like some sort of ritual marking to me. I've seen stuff like that before, usually on ancient, cursed trees in old mythology books."

"Like the ones in those ancient cultures that worshiped darkness and death?" Ember's voice dropped to a whisper, her eyes narrowing as she took a step closer to the tree. "Or the ones that used these symbols to summon... unsavory entities?"

"A darkness that dwells beyond mortal understanding," the old woman's voice creaked, her eyes seeming to bore into Ember's very soul. "A realm where the veil between worlds is thin, and the whispering shadows await their summoner's call."

"The wind whispers secrets to the crumbling stones of the forgotten towers, Ember, and the trees of the forgotten forest tremble with an ancient language that only the initiated can decipher. You have been chosen to be the keeper of the keys, to unlock the portals that lead to this realm, and to silence the whispers that threaten to unravel the very fabric of reality."

"Your quest begins on the Winter's Night of the Red Moon, when the veil between worlds is at its thinnest. Seek out the Elder Oak, its bark etched with the runes of the Ancients, and listen for the whispered guidance of the Forest Mother. The first portal awaits within the Heart of the Hollow Mountain, guarded by the whispers of the Stone Sentinels. Heed the call of the Moonstone Oracle, and your journey to unlock the secrets of the forgotten towers shall begin."

"As you stand before the Elder Oak, its branches creaking in the windless night air, the whispers of the Forest Mother grow loud in your mind. 'Walk with the Shadows, for it is in their darkness that the path to the Heart of the Mountain lies revealed.' A rustling in the underbrush signals the approach of the Moonstone Oracle, her eyes aglow with an otherworldly light. 'Beware the Shadowborn, for their whispers can be treacherous guides. Seek the hidden glade of the Ancient Keepers, where the secrets of the forgotten towers await, but only for those brave enough to challenge the Trials of Shadows'."

"Without a word, the Moonstone Oracle vanishes into the darkness, leaving you to ponder the cryptic warning. You hear the rustling of leaves behind you, and a figure emerges from the trees. It is a hooded figure, clad in tattered black robes, their face deathly pale. 'You should not have come here,' they whisper, their voice like a winter's breeze. 'The Shadowborn are always seeking, and you have just become their latest prey. You must escape the forest, before the darkness consumes you. Follow me, if you dare.'"

"The hooded figure beckons, and you hesitate for a moment before deciding to follow. They move swiftly and silently through the trees, their black robes blending with the shadows. You can't see where they're leading you, but you can sense the urgency in their whispers. As you follow, the rustling of leaves grows louder, and the darkness seems to be closing in around you. The figure stops suddenly, and you nearly crash into them. 'We're here,' they whisper, their eyes glowing faintly in the dark. 'The clearing is the only way out. But be warned, the Shadowborn lurk within, waiting to strike. Are you prepared to face them, or will you succumb to the darkness?'"

"The figure's words hang in the air like a challenge, and you feel your heart pounding in your chest. You can't help but think of the stories you've heard about the Shadowborn - creatures that feed on fear and terror. You look around, trying to see what lies ahead, but the darkness is absolute. You can't even see the figure's face, only the faint glow of their eyes. You take a deep breath, trying to steady your nerves. 'I'm ready,' you whisper, trying to sound braver than you feel. The figure nods, its eyes flashing brighter for a moment, and then turns to lead you into the clearing. As you step into the open space, you're struck by the sheer size of it. The trees seem to loom overhead, casting long, ominous shadows across the ground. You can feel the weight of the Shadowborn's gaze upon you, and you know that you can't hesitate. You need to move, to find a way out of the clearing and back to the safety of the world outside."

The air is thick with an eerie silence, and you can feel the weight of your own ragged breaths. You follow the figure, your eyes scanning the perimeter of the clearing for any sign of escape or potential allies. The trees seem to close in around you, their branches creaking ominously in the windless air. Ahead, the figure stops at the center of the clearing, its eyes fixed on a large stone monument. The monument bears an inscription in a language you don't recognize, the letters etched in a font that seems to writhe and twist like living serpents. You feel a creeping sense of dread as the figure turns to face you, its eyes burning with an otherworldly intensity. "The Shadowborn's gift awaits," it whispers, its voice like a sigh of the damned. "Are you prepared to receive it?"

The figure's words hang in the air like a challenge, and you can feel your heart pounding in your chest as you take a tentative step forward. The monument behind the figure seems to loom larger, its twisted letters seeming to pulse with a dark energy that makes your skin crawl. The figure doesn't move or speak again, its eyes fixed on you with an unblinking gaze that seems to bore into your very soul. You can feel the weight of the silence growing thicker, like a physical presence that's suffocating you. Suddenly, the wind picks up, and the branches of the trees creak and groan in protest, as if they too are being summoned to bear witness to some dark and ancient ritual. You can feel your breath catching in your throat as you realize that you're running out of time to respond. "I don't know what you're talking about," you force yourself to say, trying to keep your voice steady. But the figure's gaze doesn't waver, and you can sense its eyes burning a hole through you, as if it's searching for some hidden truth that only you can reveal.

The words feel like leaden weights on your lips, as if you've said nothing at all. The figure doesn't move or respond, its eyes still fixed on you with an unnerving intensity. The wind dies down, leaving an oppressive stillness in its wake, and the only sound is the heavy thud of your own heartbeat in your ears. You can feel the weight of the moment bearing down on you, like a physical pressure that threatens to crush you beneath its oppressive might. And then, as if to add to the sense of foreboding, a single branch from the twisted tree behind the figure snaps off and falls to the ground, its dry leaves crackling in protest like the very gates of hell creaking open. The figure's gaze seems to flicker towards the branch, and for an instant, you sense a glimmer of something - perhaps curiosity, perhaps hunger - flash in its eyes.

As the branch hits the ground, the stillness is shattered, and a faint, unsettling creaking fills the air, like the slow, deliberate groaning of ancient, rusty hinges. The figure's gaze lingers on the fallen branch for a moment longer, before it shifts its unblinking stare back to you, its eyes burning with an unspoken intent. The air is heavy with the scent of damp earth and decaying leaves, and you can feel the weight of the silence growing more oppressive by the second, as if the very darkness itself was condensing into a palpable, menacing presence. And then, without warning, the figure takes a slow, deliberate step forward, its movements as stiff and jerky as a puppet on worn strings, its eyes fixed on you with an unnerving, almost palpable hunger.

As the figure takes its step closer, the creaking of the branch seems to synchronise with the rhythm of its movements, the sound echoing through the darkness like a dirge, drawing out the heavy, oppressive silence and stretching it taut like a tightened bowstring. The air around you seems to thicken, heavy with anticipation, as if the very fabric of reality was bending to accommodate the approaching figure, its presence warping the shadows into twisted, unnatural shapes that seem to writhe and twist around its feet like living tendrils. The scent of damp earth and decay grows stronger, a noxious miasma that clings to the back of your throat, choking off your breath and filling your senses with a creeping sense of dread.

As the figure draws nearer, its features begin to take shape, like the slow, agonizing revelation of a nightmare. The face is long and gaunt, with skin that appears to be stretched taut over the underlying bone structure, giving it a macabre, death's-head quality. The eyes, sunken and dark, seem to burn with a malevolent intensity, as if they contain some ancient, festering evil that is slowly seeping out into the world. The mouth, a thin, bloodless line, is twisted into a grotesque, asymmetrical grin, as if it is perpetually relishing some ghastly, inner joke.

Its presence seems to fill the air with an unspeakable stench, like the ripe decay of a long-forgotten corpse, and the hairs on the back of my neck stand on end as I try to speak, my voice caught in my parched throat as if paralyzed by some dark, unseen force.

My eyes scan the darkness, straining to pierce the shadows that seem to writhe and twist around me like living tendrils, as I stumble backward, desperate to escape the crushing weight of this unnameable horror, but every step I take only seems to bring me closer, drawing me inexorably towards the abyss that yawns before me like a chasm of black despair.

The air grows colder, heavy with the scent of damp earth and decay, as I feel the darkness seeping into my pores, infecting my very soul, and I stumble, my foot catching on something hard and unyielding, sending me crashing to the ground, where I lie paralyzed with fear, unable to move or scream, as the horror closes in around me, its presence a palpable thing, a living entity that wraps around me like a shroud, suffocating me with its crushing malevolence.

I try to scream, but my voice is trapped in my throat, silenced by some unseen force, as the darkness begins to take shape around me, twisting and writhing like a living thing, its tendrils reaching out to snuff out the last vestiges of light in my mind, and I feel my vision begin to blur and fade, as if the very fabric of reality is unraveling before my eyes, leaving only an endless, crushing darkness that threatens to consume me whole.

And in that darkness, I sense a presence, ancient and malevolent, its icy breath caressing my scalp, its cold, dead eyes boring into my soul, whispering cruel promises in a voice that is both familiar and yet utterly alien, as the last vestiges of my sanity begin to fray and unravel, like the threads of a tapestry torn asunder by some unseen hand, and I realize with a growing sense of horror that I am not alone in this abyss, that there are others, lurking just beyond the edge of perception, waiting for the perfect moment to strike, their presence weaving in and out of the shadows like a dark, maddening refrain.

As I struggle to maintain a grasp on reality, the whispers in my ear grow louder, more insistent, the promises of terror and despair spilling from the dark mouth like a dark, viscous liquid, and I feel myself being drawn deeper into the abyss, the walls of my mind crumbling, the screams of the damned echoing through the void, as the presence closes in, its cold, dead fingers reaching for me, and I know that I am but a mere pawn in some ancient, malevolent game, played out on a board of madness and horror, with myself as the unwitting sacrifice, and the others, the silent, shadowy Others, watching with glinting, sadistic eyes, as I succumb to the darkness, forever trapped in this living hell of terror and despair.

The air is thick with the stench of decay and corruption, and I can feel the weight of the Others' gaze upon me, their malevolent presence crushing the last vestiges of my sanity. I am consumed by a creeping sense of dread, as if I am being slowly devoured by some unseen force, and I can sense that I am not alone in this living nightmare. There is something within me, a presence that is older than I can comprehend, a presence that has been awakened by some ancient and forgotten power. It stirs, sensing the presence of the Others, and I can feel its dark energy coursing through my veins, urging me to surrender to the madness that threatens to consume me.

As I stand there, frozen in terror, I feel the presence growing stronger, its power coursing through my mind like a black and twisting river. I try to scream, but my voice is lost in the void, swallowed by the crushing weight of the Others' malevolent gaze. The air seems to vibrate with an otherworldly energy, and I can feel the presence of the Others closing in around me, their dark and twisted forms weaving in and out of the shadows like living darkness. And at the center of it all, I sense the presence, old and malevolent, waiting to claim me as its own, its dark and twisted consciousness reaching out to snuff out the last flicker of my sanity.

The darkness begins to seep into my eyes, tendrils of shadowy mist creeping in to obscure my vision. I can feel it wrapping itself around my brain, extinguishing the sparks of thought and reason, drawing me closer to the abyss of madness. And then, I see it, a void within the void, a chasm of infinite blackness that seems to be pulling me down, inexorably, into the depths of the Others' abyssal soul.

The abyssal soul's presence whispers sweet nothings in my ear, a siren's call that draws me deeper into the void, where the silence is oppressive and the darkness is alive, its tendrils writhing like living things, seeking to consume me whole. As I descend, the chasm widens, its walls composed of forgotten memories, shattered dreams, and the screaming of the damned.

And I find myself face to face with the echoes of my own making, the whispers of regret and longing that have haunted me for an eternity. The darkness seems to revel in my presence, its tendrils slithering around me like cold, black fingers, probing every crevice of my soul. I can feel the abyssal soul's presence growing stronger, its power coursing through my veins like a dark, intoxicating elixir.

As I stand there, frozen in a mixture of fascination and terror, the abyssal soul begins to speak to me in a voice that is both ancient and eternal, its words dripping with malevolent intent and whispered secrets that send shivers down my spine. "You have summoned me, mortal," it hisses, "and now you will pay the price for your arrogance. Your deepest fears and desires are mine to command, and I will use them to bend you to my will." The darkness closes in around me, a crushing weight that threatens to consume me whole, and I know that I am but a mere pawn in a game of cosmic horror beyond my comprehension.

"The game is not just about you, mortal," the abyssal soul continues, its voice weaving a dark melody that seems to sear itself into my brain, "but about the very fabric of reality itself. Your soul is a thread in a tapestry of terrors, and I shall unravel it with gentle care. Your screams of agony will be the symphony that guides the cosmic forces, bringing forth a reckoning that will shatter the boundaries of sanity and plunge the universe into eternal chaos." As the soul's words linger in the air, the shadows around me begin to take shape, forming twisted, eldritch creatures that watch me with cold, calculating eyes, their presence drawing me closer to the brink of madness.

"As the abyssal soul's melody reaches a crescendo, the creatures' forms begin to blur and merge, their eyes burning with an otherworldly green fire that seems to pierce the very fabric of my being. I feel my grip on reality slipping, like a stone tumbling down a chasm of madness, as the soul's promise of unraveling my soul is met with an eternal, maddening refrain: 'Your screams will be the catalyst, mortal, the spark that sets the universe ablaze with chaos.' The creatures' presence now envelops me, a swirling vortex of eldritch horrors that seems to be drawing me deeper into the abyss, and I am powerless to resist, trapped in a living nightmare from which there is no awakening."

"As I stumble forward, my vision blurring into a kaleidoscope of twisted forms and eldritch energies, I can feel my mind unraveling like a threadbare tapestry, the very fabric of my sanity tearing apart at the seams. The creatures' whispers now a maddening chorus in my ear, a cacophony of grotesque harmony that seems to be weaving a spell of ultimate destruction. The abyssal soul's melody, now a symphony of chaos, thrums through every cell of my being, and I can feel my identity dissolving like mist before a bonfire, my mortal form surrendering to the void's dark allure. The universe, once a cold and unfathomable expanse, now closes in around me like a razor-sharp vice, ready to crush me beneath its abyssal weight."

"The words 'I am not alone' echo through my fractured thoughts, a whispered admission from the unseen voices that now share my mind, their presence a chilling reminder that I am but a mere pawn in a game of cosmic horrors. The darkness within me, long-simmering and hungry, now begins to awaken, its tendrils creeping through my numb limbs like icy fingers, as if the very essence of the void has taken residence in my soul. And with each struggling heartbeat, I sense the abyssal presence drawing closer, its malevolent gaze burning into my essence like a brand, etching my existence with the mark of ultimate surrender."

"As the abyssal presence inches closer, the echoes of the whispers grow louder, a cacophony of madness that seeps into my mind like a chilling mist. I feel my thoughts shattering like brittle glass, my sanity unraveling thread by thread, as the darkness within me reaches a critical mass, threatening to consume me whole. The numbness gives way to an agonizing awareness, a dawning horror that I am not just a pawn, but a mere conduit for the eldritch forces that lurk beyond the veil of reality. And with each faltering breath, I become more acutely aware of the impending doom that awaits, as the void within me hungrily devours the very fabric of my being, erasing the tattered remnants of my humanity and leaving only a hollow, screaming shell in its place."

"The echoes of my own screams are drowned out by the reverberations of the whispers, as the abyssal presence draws nearer, its malevolent energy suffusing every cell of my being, animating the dark forces that lurk within me. I feel my eyes slipping from their sockets, my skin decaying to a parchment-like texture, as the flesh melts away, revealing the gaping void that has been expanding within me. The whispers grow clearer, a hideous chanting that mocks my very existence, as the darkness within me reaches its critical mass, and I am consumed by the very horror I have been trying to escape. And yet, in the fleeting moments before my sanity is extinguished, I sense a twisted purpose in the darkness, a desire to unleash the eldritch forces that lurk beyond the veil of reality upon an unsuspecting world, as I become a vessel for the abyssal presence, a mere puppet controlled by the void that now dwells within me."

"And so, with my consciousness shattered, my mind a mere echo chamber for the will of the abyss, I am driven to unleash the horrors that lie beyond the veil, as the whispers coalesce into a cacophony of madness, and I become a conduit for the eldritch powers that seek to reclaim this pitiful world as their own. The flesh continues to wither away, revealing the true horror that lies beneath, as I rise from the grave, a servant of the void, bound to carry out the twisted will of the darkness that now animates my undead form. And with each step I take, the world around me begins to unravel, as the fabric of reality grows thin and weak, ready to be torn asunder by the unholy forces that lurk just beyond the edge of perception, waiting to be unleashed upon an unsuspecting humanity, as I, a mere puppet of the void, bring about a dawn of unspeakable horror, and herald the arrival of an era of unending terror and madness."

"As I stalk through the desolate streets, the darkness seeping from every pore, my very presence draws forth the shadows, like a magnet drawing forth the damned, while the stars above twist and writhe in agony, as if tormented by the horrors I bring, and the winds howl with a madness that is almost intelligible, a cacophony of despair and hopelessness, as if the very fabric of existence is tearing asunder, and the silences between screams seem to grow longer, as the world succumbs to the void's abyssal grasp, and I, an instrument of the eldritch, revel in the apocalyptic splendor of this new world, where the mad and the damned roam free, and all is consumed by the abyss's all-encompassing darkness."

"The streets are mine to claim, a domain of eternal night, where the flickering torches of sanity cast no light, and the echoes of my footsteps are the only sound that pierces the stillness, as the buildings around me seem to lean in, as if to listen to the whispered secrets of the abyss, and the very earth itself appears to tremble, as if the weight of my malevolent presence is crushing the last vestiges of hope, and I, a herald of the abyss, summon forth the legions of the night, to revel in the beauty of the void, and to dance with the damned, under the sickly yellow glow of the moon, now a ghastly moon, a corpse-like orb that hangs low in the sky, a constant reminder of the desolate world that lies ahead, where all is consumed, and nothing is left but the void's eternal whisper, a susurrus of madness, that whispers sweet nothings to the souls of the damned, drawing them closer, closer, to the abyss's waiting maw."
